emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Code Autonomation
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of autonomously writing, testing, and deploying software, reducing human involvement in coding to oversight and strategic decision-making.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Significant changes in job roles within IT, potential for increased efficiency but also concerns about job displacement.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Requires advancements in AI reliability, trust in AI for critical tasks, and regulatory frameworks for AI in software development.

emerging_technologies.name: Quantum-Resistant Blockchain
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain systems designed to withstand attacks from quantum computers, ensuring long-term security for digital transactions and data.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Enhances trust in digital transactions and supports the longevity of blockchain technology in a post-quantum world.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Depends on the progression of quantum computing and the development of new cryptographic algorithms.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Lace
emerging_technologies.description: A brain-computer interface that directly integrates with human neural tissue to enhance cognitive capabilities or control external devices.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential for cognitive enhancement, ethical concerns about privacy, consent, and equity in access.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Ethical approval, medical safety validations, and public acceptance of brain modification technology.

emerging_technologies.name: Zero-Energy Buildings
emerging_technologies.description: Buildings designed to consume no net energy over a year, producing as much energy as they use through renewable means.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces carbon footprint, promotes energy independence, and could lead to shifts in urban planning.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Cost reduction in renewable energy technologies, regulatory incentives, and public demand for sustainable living.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI Pair Programming
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems that work in real-time with human developers, offering suggestions, writing code, and performing automated testing.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widely adopted in tech companies, integrated into development workflows, with educational systems adapting to teach alongside AI.

mainstream_technologies.name: Autonomous Delivery Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Vehicles designed to deliver goods autonomously, reducing human involvement in last-mile delivery.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Common in urban areas, with regulatory frameworks established to manage traffic and safety.

epoch_themes.description: A focus on ensuring AI systems are developed and used in ways that are ethical, transparent, and beneficial to society.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Promotes trust in technology, influences policy-making, and could lead to new ethical frameworks for tech development.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing public and governmental interest in AI ethics, leading to international standards and regulations.

epoch_themes.description: A shift towards technologies that minimize environmental impact and promote sustainability.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Encourages a circular economy, reduces environmental degradation, and fosters innovations in energy and material use.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Global push for green technology, influenced by climate change initiatives and resource scarcity concerns.
